title: Tailwind CSS Responsiveness & Interactivity
description: Flashcards focused on responsive design, interactive states, and positioning notations in Tailwind CSS.

cards.q: How do you apply styles for different screen sizes?
cards.a: Use responsive prefixes like sm:, md:, lg:, xl:, and 2xl: before utility classes.
Apply background color red-500 on screen sizes small and larger.

cards.q: How to make an element hidden on mobile but visible on desktop?
cards.a: Use hidden and lg:block classes.
Allows applying hover styles to child elements when the parent has hover state.
Prefix classes with focus:, e.g., focus:outline-none.
Prefix classes with active:, e.g., active:bg-blue-700.
Allows sibling elements to style based on state of a peer element.

cards.q: How does Tailwind handle dark mode?
cards.a: Using dark: prefix, styles apply when dark mode is enabled.

cards.q: What is the purpose of the container class?
cards.a: Centers and applies responsive max-widths to layout containers.

cards.q: How to use arbitrary values in Tailwind?
cards.a: Use square brackets, e.g., w-[72px] for custom widths.
overflow-auto, overflow-hidden, overflow-scroll, etc.
Use transition classes like transition, transition-colors.
Use cursor-pointer, cursor-default, etc.
Use z-0, z-10, z-50, etc.

cards.q: What does the relative class do?
cards.a: Sets position: relative on an element.

cards.q: How to make an element fixed at the top?
cards.a: Use fixed top-0 classes.

cards.q: How to apply gap in flexbox?
cards.a: Use gap- classes similar to grid layouts.
Maintains fixed aspect ratios, e.g., aspect-w-16 aspect-h-9.
Use ring, ring-offset, ring-color classes for outline rings.
Use snap-start, snap-center, snap-x, snap-y classes.
